result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Not possess any dangerous weapons. 
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Remain within Sheboygan County.
Comply with day reporting requirements - GPS

12:57 PM Defendant Rodney Lee Harding appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Charles Donald Wingrove in court for Rodney Lee Harding.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense requests to reduce cash bond to $500 cash. State indicates $2,000 cash bond appropriate, deft had previous bench warrants, discretion up to the Court. Atty Wingrove informs the Court client is a veteran, is retired and hs ben of $1200 p/month, would have to reestablish residence. Court amends cash bond to $1,000 and adds to remain w/in Sheboygan County. State will prepare global off and send to Atty Wingrove and Atty Limbeck.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 11:30 am.
